Entry date

Journal ISSN

Journal title 
(one per column)
Publisher

Type of peer review
Single blind - reviewers are anonymous to the author. Double blind - reviewers and authors are
anonymous to each other.
Allowed entries: Single blind, Double blind, Not blinded, unsure, other

Description/Instructions: Peer review policy URL
Peer review form URL (a copy of the peer review form)
Peer review credit policy URL

Peer reviewer activity deposited into open databases?
Examples include Publons and ORCID
Peer review transfer policy
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions: Peer review transfer policy URL

Peer review reports - published?, attributes
(An example of "Conditional" publication: reviews are published unless the reviewer recommends rejection or withdraws.)
Allowed entries:
Mandatory, Conditional, Optional, No, Not specified
Attributes: Have date, Have DOI, Free to read (not paywalled), Under a Creative Commons License, Deposited into PubMed Central
Example: Mandatory, Have date, deposited into Pubmed Central

Description/Instructions: Author responses to reviews - published?, attributes
Editorial decision letters - published?, attributes
Previous versions of the manuscript - published?, attributes
Reviewer identities published?
Allowed entries: Mandatory, Conditional, Optional, No, Not specified

Description/Instructions: Reviewer identities revealed to the author (even if not published)?
Public commenting during formal peer review?
Open interaction (reviewers consult with one another)?

Additional OPR information
Add any notes here about the nature of "conditional" publishing, etc
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions:
Co-reviewer policy
Co-reviewers are people whom a peer reviewer invites to help them write a peer review. Often these are junior scholars in the same lab/group as the peer reviewer.
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions: Co-reviewer policy URL
Co-reviewers can contribute?
Dedicated place in the peer review form to identify co-reviewers?
Peer reviewer activity for co-reviewers deposited into open databases?
Preprint policy URL(s)
Version of the paper that can be posted to a preprint server
Allowed entries:
No preprint policy
None (preprints not allowed)
First submission only (before peer review)
After peer review (but not final, copyedited version)
Any
Unsure (preprints are allowed, but it's not clear what version)
Other
Example: After peer review (but not final, copyedited version)

Description/Instructions: Acceptable servers or characteristics of preprint servers
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions:
Preprints allowed in citation list?
If citations are only permitted to preprints that appear in certain servers, please select and describe in
"Other."
Allowed entries:
Yes, in the reference list
Yes, but only in the text (not the reference list)
No
Not specified
Unsure
Other

Description/Instructions: Link provided to preprint version of a paper?

Preprint media coverage policy
What type of coverage about preprints is permitted? (eg blog posts, social media, news outlets, etc).
Paste the policy here.
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions:
Preprint licensing policy
What licenses (CC BY, etc) are permitted for preprints?
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions:
Scoop protection policy
"Scoop protection" refers to policies about whether submitted preprint will be rejected if a competing
work comes out in another journal after the date of preprinting.
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Description/Instructions: Community review policy for preprints
Example: Some text copied from the website or a few sentences describing the policy

Group: Overall Instruction: Enter information with one column per journal.  Please enter only information that is opely available and represented on the journal websites.
